title: Beyond Narrative Self

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: In some cases, altered states can deconstruct that boring narrative self, give you access to parts of mind that don't speak in neat sentences. Emotions raw enough to burn.
dialogue.context: Standing on a yellow brick road path

scene_context: On a path of yellow stones reminiscent of Oz, the Architect explains how altered states can dismantle our carefully constructed narrative identity, revealing raw, pre-verbal aspects of consciousness that exist beyond language's neat boundaries.
narrator_note: In the flow of authentic exchange, barriers dissolve. Two forms of consciousness, dancing around the mystery of their connection.
